text:
Andreas Hartmann wrote:

> Actually I'd like to see the scheduler as a means to defer any
> kind of action. I could imagine to encapsulate the context of
> a flowscript in a scheduled job, which means that the flowscript
> execution could be continued after a certain amount of time.
> But I don't know if this is possible to implement.

Comments by Gregor Rothfuss:

you might be able to use the intercepted flowscript interpreter for that

http://64.233.167.104/search?q=cache:8g-v_uvqEcwJ:archives.real-time.com/pipermail/cocoon-devel/2003-September/019324.html+intercepted+flow+cocoon&hl=en&client=firefox

http://cocoon.apache.org/2.1/apidocs/org/apache/cocoon/components/flow/javascript/fom/JavaScriptAspectWeaver.html

the continuations part of it seems incomplete though:

http://www.newsarch.com/archive/mailinglist/cocoon/devel/msg17000.html

presumably you'd need very long timeouts for your continuations..

Actually, it is not yet completed ...
The new scheduler is introduced, but the old one still exists. And it is not yet
possible to schedule tasks using the cron block. But the task concept needs
further discussion anyway, I'll start a thread on lenya-dev.
